Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SaraSukor Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Easter Sunday weekend and the price offered was lower or the same as youth hostels in Barcelona. We liked the quiet area, away from touristy areas (even the Gaudi park is a 20 minute walk away) but close enough to get to them (about 3-5 stops away on the Metro). Direction given on hotel website from the Metro was not detailed so we ended walking around for a bit looking for it. Hotel name is Putxet, which is the same as Putget street on the map at the Metro. Our room had 2 huge single beds and flat screen tv with a few English channels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: designsbykari
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with a tour group. My room was on the 6th floor and had a great view of the city. The location was okay, there was access to the metro and you can easily get to tourist sites, but we could not be dropped off in front of the hotel due to narrow roads and had to haul our luggage up hill from the main road. Meals were served to our group buffet style and there were a lot of good choices. The bathroom was a little dated and could use repair, but overall the room was comfortable. The lobby is a beautiful space with lots of room to sit and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside the city area”
Reviews.Author: loveducks
Reviews.Content: We stayed with this hotel as part of the Contiki tour. The coach is not able to park outside the hotel because of it's narrow roads. So we are dropped along the main road and we had to drag our luggage for about 10-15mins uphill to where the hotel is. Perdestrian roads leading to the hotel were narrow as well. Luggage with wheels is definately an advantage here. The hotel is part of a chain hotels and it's quite a decent size, different from the family hotel we had been staying in. The lifts are small and wouldn't fit more than 2 people and 4 luggages so once again it's carrying the luggage up to the 4th floor. The room is a decent size, old decor but it's clean. The bed is a proper twin size bed and there's enough space to actually open our luggage up. There's a wooden rack/shelve which I assume it's for luggage but we just place ours on the floor. There's a long writing desk which is useful and the TV sits on it. There is also English channel which is great for following up on the latest world news. No Kettle or cups provided in the room. Plastic cups were provided in the bathroom.Internet provided in rooms which is always a plus. No mini fridge but there is a safe in the cupboard. However to use the safe, you need to pay 5Euro per day and a 50Euro deposit to the reception. We just lock all our valuables in the luggage. The flooring is wooden which also adds to the cleaniness. The bathroom isn't very and there's a bidet in it. Shower over bathroom and it's very tiny. Because the light is just where the entry is, the shower area is very dim, makes it very creepy when taking a shower. The window in the bathroom can be opened slightly but you get to hear the bathroom next door. In fact the room are so closed to one another you do not even need to open the windows. We are advise the tapwater in Barcelona might give us stomachache. The nearest metro station from the hotel is about 20mins walk and another 20-30mins into the city. Single trip ticket is about $1.50Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: vlgraf13
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was really nice and helpful with all our many questions. We had trouble with the door and handyman came right up. Everything seemed fairly clean and in order. The window view was nice out to some homes. There was one ant in the window in the bathroom and since I generally freak out about any bugs made my husband verify that it was in fact an ant. The one little issue was that the hotel location is a little confusing and at the top of a hill-- We were only there for 2 nights so I am sure we would have been more oriented if we had put some more effort in to sorting out directions; although, I woudn't really say the location was super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: dmowatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable for our whrillwind trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “never again. terrible. no privacy. no mini bar. like a youth hostel. shame”
Reviews.Author: perli30
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel during 7 days. the location is horrible. you have to climb the top of the mountain by walking. the single room is like a cabin in jail. the reception's attitude is very insulting. no mini bar in rooms. the only thing that i liked was breakefast. but there is no room for all the guests so you have to wait a lot of time till you get a table. never again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: bricketts
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews online I expected the worse but was pleasantly surprised at many things of the Putxet. First of all it is a bit of a walk from the metro... all uphill. But that was just exercise that most of us need anyway ;) The streets outside were very narrow and the hotel entrance unassuming. But I was delighted to find an elevator which I had read there was none. My room was on the 4th floor and it was quite spacious with a A/C control. Also the window opened quite wide and although there wasn't much of a view it was nice to be able to open the window to the evening air. The hotel is situated in a quiet area so I was able to leave my room window open all night and the added bonus is that I never saw ONE insect in the five days I was in Barcelona... The room was spacious enough with two beds. The bathroom was completely in marble and had a heat lamp. The pressure of water on the shower was impressive. The beds were comfortable and the mattresses firm which I like :) Most surprising were the breakfasts. A full breakfast with everything imaginable on the buffet. I mostly went for the bacon and eggs, yogurt, fruit and bread... but there was so much more. Many people commmented on the delicious potato pie but I didn't get a chance to sample it. Also closeby is a lovely little pizzeria and for about 15 E you could get a delicious thin crust pizza and several glasses of wine. Would I stay here again? definitely. I felt safe and although there was a bit of a walk uphill from the metro the exercise did me good :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: kanikab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Putxet with several college students (I am a college professor). After a few lesser hotels in Italy and an arduous ferry ride to Barcelona, the Putxet was a sight for sore eyes. They actually have working WiFi which is quite difficult to find in European hotels in general, good food in their restaurant, and very spacious accommodations, even using American standards. However, I found the staff to be brusque and often quite rude. The front desk staff was ok, but the food service staff definitely left much to be desired. However, it was not bad enough to not recommend the hotel. It is not the most prime neighborhood for tourism, but they offer clean, comfortable, spacious rooms near bars, restaurants, stores and currency exchanges! FYI, stating that 3 people will be sharing a room will garner you three small beds (one of which is more of a couch) while stating that only 2 people are staying in a room will garner you two full size beds which would fit 3-4 guests. The room is bigger also. They call it a double.

Reviews.Title: “I would not give more than 2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: UmutAYildiz
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed. I deceived with their 4 star category but the quality is no more than 2 star hotel. We first booked a double room but when we arrive there, there was only one double room something like in a construction phase. Besides, you are there in August and terribly need a fridge to put cold drinks. Surely, there was no fridge. We went down and asked the arrogant receptionist that we surely need a fridge which was already written in the booking confirmation. They gave a twin room (apparently this was also the last one) with a working fridge. Twin room seemed much worse but we had to accept it because fridge was a real priority. Anyway, it is also too far away to anything. If you do not want to go to Guell Park everyday there is no more attraction. The metro takes 10-15 min to reach.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel that's too far away”
Reviews.Author: Grahamc84
Reviews.Content: Checkin staff were rude and mostly unfriendly and hotel was in a very dull area with no nightlife. Rooms were small with paper this walls, however, bathroom was spacious and clean. Tv was only in spanish except Sky News. One positive was that as the hotel was up the hills we spent most of our time away from the hotel and in the city. Bar was dead and empty and hotel was mostly lifeless. View from our room of a wall and the bins was inspiring. Far too expensive at €310 for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “quite well”
Reviews.Author: travellinaRM
Reviews.Content: this hotel is quite cheap, maybe the four stars are a little tooo ;) much for it. we have been here for 3 night, from the hotel is fastly reaching the center of bc, it's well connected by pubblic transports. breackfast and dinner's foods are the same, there is no differences between, there is few attention at the quality and at the services, instead the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: IheartNYC25
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. When we arrived, I went to have a shower and the bath started filling up even though the plug wasn't in. I looked around properly and realised that it was doing this to to so much hair being stuck in the drains and there were clumps of hair all over the shower walls. I'd say there were around 20-30 hairs per clump. We asked to speak with the manager and were told to just "switch rooms". Although the shower didn't have the same issues as the other room it's was just a dirty. The floors were filthly and we would have left this hotel if we weren't on tour with Contiki. I'm surprised Contiki choose to stay at this hotel. Our tour and hotels were great except for this hotel as I'd give it a 1 out of 5 and not a 3 out of 5 as promised on our tour. This hotel was very far away from the city centre but I guess that's what you pay for. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, far from the metro, the hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: ussmax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is disposed in a quiet area far enough from the metro (Station Lesseps green route 10-15 minutes walk). Minuses: - In the evening return to the hills is very difficult. - For the use of safe, we were asked to pay. - The bath is old and worn, the water flowed out of the shower is very weak. - Poor sound isolation (we heard the door close and open water are our neighbors) Pluses: - Relatively inexpensive - Distance to park Guell 15 minutes walk - Quiet and cultured neighborhood - Cleanly

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel. Location...not so good.”
Reviews.Author: StarBrigt7
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Barcelona on a Meditteranean tour so we weren't responsible for choosing the hotel. However, of all the hotels we stayed in while on our trip this was certainly one of the largest, and had one of the cleanest bathrooms. I've spent a good chunk of time in Barcelona in the past and although I thought the hotel itself was clean, quiet and had a helpful staff I wished it was closer to the subway station and that they had their wifi up and running. If you're not planning on traveling via subway and aren't relying on the hotel's internet services, you should stay at this hotel. Otherwise go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Quiet Location.”
Reviews.Author: aaSilverFox
Reviews.Content: this hotel in in a quiet location, which is sometimes hard to find in BCN ! rooms were adequate, B'fast @ 7 Euros not bad. We did suffer 2 power cuts whilst there which could freak people out if you were in elevator at the time. Free Wi-Fi throughout hotel was a blessing and overall the stay was good, although it them 2 days to change our broken fridge !

Reviews.Title: “Haha, 4 star? No way”
Reviews.Author: GaborLondon
Reviews.Content: I had my worst experience during my stay at this hotel. I am not a fussy or choosy person, but first time in my life i had to change hotel before i could fall asleep at the first night. The room was smaller then a luggage compartment, although fairly clean (not spotless). Bathroom might have been cleaner as it is expected from a 4 star hotel. Still laughing at the 4 star granted to this hotel. When the hotel is full or have many guests then keep off this hotel. By the time i arrived the hotel seemed empty, and i got my room quickly, paid a lot for that. After going out, i went back to the hotel to sleep just realized my room was right above main entrance, with a huge sliding. The noise was unbearable. As there is nothing in the area, all the guests sat around the main entrance and the lobby, were very noisy. Literally, 2 metres from my window. As the sliding door open and closed, i could feel as my bed was vibrating, and unluckily, the door opened and closed in every 5-10 seconds. Otherwise, the corridor inside was quite busy and the door was far from the be sound proof. U could understand easily what the people were talking about even 10 metres from the door. This time was the volcano ash problem in the air, and i wasnt able to fly home. After a sleepless night waiting for confirmation about my flight, what was cancelled finally again, i found this hotel, where i met with these problems written above. So i tried to make changes at the reception, where the hardly english speaker receptionist refused to check how he can help me about to switch to another room, and refused to give me refund for the second night what i was about to spend in another hotel. The receptionist showed totally no respect to me as turned his back to me and didnt listen to my inquiry. Finally after 30 minutes arguing, i could get some money back, and i moved out. The guy was absolutely mean, rude. I hope he is gonna be fired as he is not suitable for that role where the politeness, helpfulness would be the first. Unfortunately him, as most of the staff missed these qualities. I warmly recommend everybody to keep off this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: LucasLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We made a booking via the tourist office at the main railway station when we got stuck in Spain due to the volcanic eruptions. Despite having 4 stars, we got a room for just EUR 60. And the beds were so big, you could have had 4 people in 2 queen beds. As we were just in and out, we did not really take advantage of any facilities. Checking in was a bit difficult as they got inundated with bookings due to he cheap fare and so they had more bookings than they could handle. But they got in touch with another hotel and directed guest there straight away and successfully. The hotel is clean and the rooms are great value. The hotel is also very close to Park Guell, so this is very useful. So if you can get this for a good price, there is very little to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay for a budget”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: A Half Decent Stay in Barcelona May 05, 2007 Value: Location: Cleanliness: Amenities: Bed: Bathroom & Shower: Service: Edit Review Delete Review Review of Hotel Park Putxet. This hotel is located at Putxet 68-71 in Barcelona, Spain. I stayed here as part of a tour with company called Contiki in 2007. It was a decent hotel, had nice rooms and good elevators. It was walking distance to the local metro to which you could make it to many different places. From Lesseps you can get to The Ramblas (town centre, lots of tourists) in 10 minutes. The hotel is also close to the Parc Guell where you can see a lovely view of the whole city from a great height. The rooms were clean but abit small and I found left over bread and bread crumbs in my sheets. I'm not sure where that came from. The room overall seemed quite average for a 4 star hotel. The walls were also quite thin. You could hear our Contiki group talking and drinking in the hallway. The bathroom is quite stylish and modern, and you are given complimentary toiletries, including a toothbrush, shoe horn and shower cap. As well as a shower there is a bath tub, but for some reason the plug was too small for the hole so I couldn't run a bath as the water would immediately drain away. The staff were ok, not very good at speaking English, one lady in particular had an attitude as if she didn't want to be there. Although, I had to stay at another hotel the night before, as the actual price for one night was over 200 euros a night, So I say don't bother. Overall, it was not bad place to stay, but I would reconsider my locations and go more centre of the city. Good for single people or someone on tight budget

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: cw1706
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for a week in November as part of a university field trip and everyone was really disappointed with the hotel. Firstly, one of the beds in our room was missing half of a leg and on calling reception someone came to fit a new one. Then the air conditioning unit only let out hot air because it was winter (however it was still very warm at that time of the year) so we were forced to sleep with the windows open and were woken up every single night at around 4am when the bins were emptied (which seemed to take half an hour). The hotel was unbelievable noisy. On the last day we had a cockroach crawl out of the sink. Despite this the rooms seemed quite clean. All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, as alongside the problems, it is also quite far out from Barcelona's main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: msukevtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, was booked by our tour group. A few general things about European hotels I've learned on my travels: - all tend to be small - don't pull the cord in the shower, it supposedly signals an alarm to the front desk for help - walls are thin - I still don't know how to use that other bowl shaped sink-faucet thing next to the toilet The lobby and dining area was decent and somewhat modern looking. The room was pretty large, but a little old looking and worn. Nothing too much stood out from the hotel. The staff was ok, they seemed understaffed though, we waited a long time just to turn in our key. The location is pretty bad. The closest metro is down a hill about 20 minutes away, and then you have to take the metro for another 15 minutes to town. So it's a bit of an effort just to get to town. Overall, I'd try to find a hotel closer to the city, it was in conveniently far from anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Nice staff. Excellent breakfast. OK if you like walking.”
Reviews.Author: MalWales
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Saturday evening, a well mannered receptionist, and a nice room at the back of the hotel (5th floor) looking over Barcelona. The receptionist gave us a map of the city and after a quick drink, directed us to a nice local bar that spoke english (and french). Very nice italian restaurant 50 yards away as well. The room was spacious, clean, and we found the hotel quiet. Comfortable is a good summary. Not a 4 star, but for the money it more than meets expectations. Its quite hilly in the rea, so not a good choice if you don't mind walking a bit. There is no garden area at the hotel, but we used it as a base, so that didn't really concern us. Breakfast was excellent - eggs, bacon, hams, cheese, fruit salad, juice etc - again very clean. All local bars and shops were very helpful - directions, making food, where not to go, who does what etc, and the hotel is a few hundred yards from Park Guell (if you want to see the Gaudi archtecture for free). Lesseps Metro is literally 200 yards walk, and a nice cafe opposite it. Restaurants in the area were friendly and full of locals. No tramps or beggars. Its better to eat in this area than anywhere near Las Rambals - which is very expensive a bit overbearing. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: solotraveller09
Reviews.Content: I ended my trip here and hated every minute of it. I checked in to my room... 121. First floor. Very noisy. Heard everything from every room. Heard when people arrived home from a night out. Phones ringing etc. Head the toilet flush... Had to wear earplugs the whole time. There was no light from the outside. Room looked out onto a concrete 10X10 courtyard. TV crap. Towels looked dirty. I was quoted $242.00 US$ for this hotel and luckily, I found it at a much cheaper rate as I would have been terribly upset if I spent that kind of money on this hotel. I looked at it as a very expensive hostel. Staff were helpful. They do speak English. Bus stop: 22 will take you to the City Centre about 20 minutes. Get off at last stop. Bus $1.35 euro. To go back to the hotel go back to the last stop and take it back - very easy. Other then that.. It really isn't around much. Oh, there is an internet cafe just down the street. Which is 1.20 euros per hour. Very nice there. They speak English. There is also a grocery store right there. This hotel is around residential area, so they do not like or try not to speak much English as they are not used to tourists around here. Hope this review helps you out.

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding, but very decent”
Reviews.Author: aprilwitch
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in Catalonia Park Putxet Hotel on my visit to Barcelona and while it didn't take my breath away, I must say I've nothing to complain about either. One of the major benefits and also the main reason to choose this hotel was the price - 6 nights in a 4-star hotel for 250 EUR is not something you come across often. So what do you get for such a small price? First of all, I was very fond of the location. Being away from La Rambla and the big tourist routes meant that it was quiet and at night you could sleep instead of burying your head under the pillow and moaning about the noise. It wasn't in the middle of nowhere either - Linea 3 (the line which can take you to all the touristy places) subway station is within a 10-minute walk, and subway is very convenient, cheap and reliable. I had no trouble getting to the hotel from the airport using public transportation as late as between 1 and 2 am. There are also small supermarkets with a very decent food selection en-route to Park Guell, which is probably about a 20-minute walk away. As for the rooms - my room was on the top floor, and it had a spacious balcony overlooking some rooftops and a green hill. In case you are lazy and can't be bothered to go to the beach, you can sunbathe on the balcony. The room itself was small, and while it was just fine for me since I was travelling alone, two people would not enjoy staying there. However, judging from the fire escape plan, my room was the smallest on the floor and perhaps they meant it to be for single use. It was clean and there were nice toiletries in the bathroom. The bath itself was also clean and had a nice modern shower. What I found lacking was the absence of a refrigerator and kettle and mugs. The staff don't speak very good English, and just like another reviewer here, I was faced with surprise from the receptionist at check-out when I tried to explain that the room has already been paid for via internet booking system. So do bring a paper where it shows you've paid - that should help. Having read some of the less positive reviews here, I was terrified of dirt and hordes of cockroaches, but must say that I have seen neither. All in all, I would say that it was very good value for money. Yes, I've seen better hotels, but I enjoyed my stay in Catalonia Park Putxet and for that price would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever DON'T GO THERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: chapa_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't possibly be 1/2 a star, and it claims to be of 4. The recepcionists and people who are supposed to help are mean and not helpful at all. The rooms are small and dirty. The odors are terrible, and everything is horrible. they treat you horribly

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: PAJK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 10 minute walk away from Lesseps metro station, but it can take a while to find as it is hidden away in a little back street. My directions: * From Lesseps head down RONDA DEL GENERAL MITRE (main road) * Stay on the right side of the road and turn right at CARRER D'HOMER * Walk up until you see CARRER D'OSONA on the left * A little walk further and on the slight left you'll see CARRER DEL PUTGET * You'll notice the hotel by the many flags hanging down from the wall From Lesseps you can get to The Ramblas (town centre, lots of tourists) in 10 minutes. The hotel is also close to the Parc Guell where you can see a lovely view of the whole city from a great height. The rooms were clean, however when I went to sleep in my newly changed bed for the second night, I found some kind of grit or crumbs under the sheet... I'm not sure where that came from. The room overall seemed quite average for a 4 star hotel. The walls were also quite thin; I could hear a lot of talking from the other rooms. The bathroom is quite stylish and modern, and you are given complimentary toiletries, including a toothbrush, shoe horn and shower cap. As well as a shower there is a bath tub, but for some reason the plug was too small for the hole so I couldn't run a bath as the water would immediately drain away. The staff are fine; not very good at speaking English, one lady in particular had an attitude as if she didn't want to be there. One gentleman tried to help me as much as he could and arranged me a taxi for my early flight home, however he became confused when I checked out and told him that I'd already paid for the room online with lastminute.com. I had to explain to him in a number of ways why I didn't owe the hotel any money. Although, I would say that the rooms were very good value for money, as when he did show me the bill (that I didn't need to pay) it only came to 75 euros for 2 nights (1 person). This hotel is not the worst one I have stayed at, but it's certainly not the best. I would recommend this if you are on a budget, but if you're not, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Big name, Poor performance”
Reviews.Author: drdeepakgoyal
Reviews.Content: I reached Spain after travelling for almost 18 hours (changes three flights to reach there). I was very much tired and sleepy. The hotel was booked before hand with confirmation letter in my hand. First of all, receptionist did not speak English. On arrival at 12:30 noon, the receptionist told me (In broken English) that room is not ready and will be ready by 3 pm. When I asked her that my booking starts at 12 noon and hotel has been informed about my arrival time, she was not ready to help. The receptionist replied that it is my problem and not their. That was enough to discourage me about the hotel. Finally I got room in 2 hours. There is severe communication gaps between different reception staffs, with one person not passing message to others. The rooms were very small, though clean. There is indeed free wifi internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: MiaQueensland
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is too far from the main city area, 10 min walk to the nearest metro. Hotel staff very unfriendly, unhelpful, unresponsive and no detail to service. Definitely not 4 star more like a 2 very tired and run-down. Rooms very basic and very small, no ironing facilities have to send out and pay. Bar fridge is a locked and safe is 5 euro a day. No DVD or Video player. Wooden floorboards thruout very noisey. Internet out of order for the whole week. Breakfast - hot food not hot, refrigerated foods not cold and fruit was not fresh. Worst hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for reaching Parc Guell, quite and reserved”
Reviews.Author: bazza78
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not very close to Las Ramblas (but that's why I like it). Relaxing, nice and friendly staff (for italian people: large part of them can speak in italian). Quite difficult to find because it's not on the main street. 10 minutes faraway by foot from Lesseps underground station.In 15 minutes you can reach town center. Rooms of various size (have been there for 3 times), clean and with good facilities. Some rooms are quite distant from wireless Internet connection so there's not a top class connection. Continental breakfast is Ok but not so wonderful for italian people(I'm italian but I'm used to stay abroad in hotel for working so no problems for me). Only 10minutes walking faraway from Park Guell, one of the most beautiful places in Barcellona in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: florida3122
Reviews.Content: I went on a tour with efcollegebreak and this is where they booked us. This place was probably one of the best places we stayed at. It had good elevators, great staff, nice rooms with a view, cold a/c., a bar, internet, and good breakfast. The staff was amazing they would do anything to help. They would always help you find something or give you directions somewhere. I was having trouble with the computer and the man at the desk would keep trying to help me. The rooms were clean and roomy. The bathrooms were bigger too. The location isnt too bad, there are restaraunts, a grocery store and internet cafe close by. The bus and metro stations are not too far and they are easy to get around on. The taxis are not too bad of a price there. Feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and so did my friends and teachers”
Reviews.Author: guapachica
Reviews.Content: well i stayed in the hotel only a few days ago and i was pleasantly surprised at the accomodation..... altough the rooms were basic we had a good sized bathroom!! i was staying with other students from my school and three teachers..... i think we all had a good stay in this hotel we made friends easily and you could always talk to the staff as they were very friendly.... there is a tube station onl 10 or so minutes away from the hotel where you can visit Las Ramblas [ which you must visit ] i truley hope i can come and stay i this hotel again it was a great experience !

Reviews.Title: “Horror and nightmare come true”
Reviews.Author: aclassen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is infested with scabies, ants, and cockroaches. Do not stay there. Many members of our 31 group reported insect infestation in their rooms, some were bitten by bed bugs. Tab water in some rooms was yellow. Hotel is very inaccessible, located far in the north, not really accessible by bus or car. Hardly any restaurants or food stores anywhere nearby. Clerks unfriendly and hastled. Massive groups stay there, so noisy and very busy. Breakfast buffet had dirty dishes. Again, do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “OK apart from the Giant Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Xlapak
Reviews.Content: After having read the earlier reviews of this hotel, I was dreading staying at this hotel. Our company had block-booked some rooms for an exhibition in Barcelona. The room although small and basic was reasonably clean and the sheets were fresh so this was a plus. The staff in general were helpful (especially the porter who killed the giant cockroach in a colleague's bathroom). It is clear that the hotel is in need of a serious deep clean - there was in fact more than one cockroach reported and the place just didn't smell fresh. Wireless is €17 for 24 hours. The location was fine and we didn't have any problems getting taxi drivers to take us back to the hotel. Only stay at this hotel if you reallly have no alternatives or you are studying cockroach behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “No words to discribe how HORRIBLE it was”
Reviews.Author: Nussyhk
Reviews.Content: I wrote this review at 3 o'clock in the morning when i was not able to sleep due to people in the halls, and water draining through pipes. THIS HOTEL SHOULD NOT BE OPERATING. AND IF IT IS, IT SHOULD BE RATED UNDER A HOMELESS SHELTER, NOT UNDER A 4 STAR HOTEL!!!!!! I have personally seen hostels that are are more comfortable and have better service than this hotel. the walls are so thin that when someone walks by your room it sounds like they are in your room walking on your head. and yes thats also at 3 in the morning too! -The lighting in the rooms are dim and cheap. - The walls are falling apart and have patches all over. - The view out your window is a wall 2 feet away. - On chili and cold nights, there is no heating. (It gets really cold) - the rooms smell like cigarette smoke and rot. - a 10-15 minute walk to the closest train or subway; and let alone finding a taxi because the hotel is in hilly residential area. - If you need cash, there is no ATM, and you are told to walk 10 minutes away to get an ATM. -If you need a drink you must go to the cold lobby and have change to buy from a soda machine. - In your hotel rooms, you constantly hear water running through draining and sewer pipes. and yes also 3 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: MoshiachNow
Reviews.Content: Room is cold and damp at night and no heat provided. Walls are covered with mold. TV not working. Overall a very uncomfortable setting. About 7 blocks far from the Metro. Taxi not easy to find as it is away from City center.Making it difficult to access with luggage, area is very hilly. Would never stay here again nor recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: sandabbi
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely does not deserve 4 star rating - the room my family were in had bits of wallpaper coming off and the bathroom looked like it could do with renovation. As far as the view was concerned - WHAT VIEW! Opened the curtain to see windows to left and right and brick walls - no sight of sky at all. Food was ok - not huge dining room but sufficient for purpose I suppose. Staff were not the friendliest. The hotel is up a big hill and didn't feel safe returning there at night as not well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Never 4 star”
Reviews.Author: romeodunn
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as it said was ideal for the centre and a 4 star hotel for this had to be taken! Was not bad for the centre although bit further than says, 4 metro stops away. I would not rate this hotel as 4 star but probably a 3 star. The room was small for a double and the wooden floors and 'paper' walls could be offputting! Staff were generally reasonably helpful although they gave me and my girlfriend the wrong directions twice. Only other problem i would say was there was a slight sewage smell right outside the hotel which, when you leave, doesnt really make you want to go back! Overall, fairly disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Content: We were sent here from another hotel because thay had overbooked. At first we were sceptical since this hotel was not as central as the one we had originally booked. But being a 4 star hotel we agreed, because we thought it would be a nice hotel. We were wrong. Not to say it terrible, but certainly not 4 stars. We have stayed in nicer 1 star hotels in Catalonia. The room looked worn and the refridgerator for the minibar was locked and they didn't have the key. The staff was generally very unhelpful and seemed to not want us to stay there (maybe because we were booked there for the price of a cheaper hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible situation in there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were a group of 58 students who are graduating this year from the University of Cyprus and decided to go for a trip in the "wonderful" city of Barcelona. as soon as we entered the hotel we were waiting for the receptionist to find available rooms for us. the lobby was ok but the surprise came later when we were finally given the keys for our rooms... as soon as i entered the room i took a look at the room. the beds the walls the windows and the airconditioning were not suitable for a 4 star hotel since they looked very old...getting in detail i discovered later that the shower was broken and i could not take a shower but i had to do it in other rooms using a towel of my own since those of the hotel were dirty... until night i was hearing girl of my group shouting and complaining that they discovered nails and hair on their beds...the situation was terrible... as for the food; the fruits were rotten and the plates were dirty and the pork was almost ...ALIVE!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Park Putxet Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Putxet 68-74, 08023 Barcelona, Spain
